meanings.definition: A person or thing that is excluded from a general statement or rule.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the main character was the only exception to the rule.
meanings.sent2: The teacher allowed no exceptions to the classroom policy.
meanings.sent3: The cat, being allergic to fish, was the exception in a house full of seafood lovers.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like an exception in a sea of indifference.
meanings.sent5: The bright red door stood out like an exception in a row of white ones.

meanings.definition: The action of not including or considering something.
meanings.sent1: The exceptions to the plan were carefully noted by the team.
meanings.sent2: He made sure to review all the exceptions before finalizing the report.
meanings.sent3: The cake recipe called for all ingredients except for one mysterious exception.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room was the exception to the usual noisy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The missing puzzle piece was the only exception to completing the picture.
